p: Since ancient times, man has used the plant kingdom as a source for clothing, construction, fuel, food, spices and medicines, as well as for poisons. Nowadays, around half the pharmaceutical drugs used in developed countries, such as aspirin, are of plant origin [ 1]. Traditional medicine is still the main source of health care for 80% of the people in developing countries, where medicinal plants are commonly used for the treatment of several ailments, notably inflammatory diseases.
